newsitem.title: GERMANY: Bundesbank holds interest rates unchanged.
newsitem.headline: Bundesbank holds interest rates unchanged.

text.p: The Bundesbank said on Thursday its policy-making council held the German discount and Lombard rates steady after its regular meeting.
The German discount rate remains at 2.50 percent and the Lombard emergency financing rate at 4.50 percent. The central bank's main money market rate, the repo, was also held steady at three percent.
Economists had not expected any change on interest rates at this point as they argued inflation was still under control, eliminating the need to tighten rates at this time.

Economists also said that the central bank's monetary policy was already quite expansive and that there was little else the central bank could do to stimulate economic growth. Consequently a rate cut was also not expected.
The central bank last cut its discount and Lombard rates in April 1996.
